dcterms:creator: V. Sitzmann
J. Thies
F. Heide
M. Niessner
G. Wetzstein
M. Zollhofer
dcterms:description: The DeepVoxels dataset includes four objects: vase, pedestal, chair, and cube. The objects are relatively simple in geometry. The training sets are formed by rendering objects via 479 poses uniformly sampled in the northern hemisphere. We reserve thirty images for validation. Another 1000 testing views are rendered on an Archimedean spiral in the northern hemisphere. All images are of 512 × 512 resolution.
dcterms:title: DeepVoxels

dcterms:creator: B. Mildenhall
P. P. Srinivasan
M. Tancik
J. T. Barron
R. Ramamoorthi
R. Ng
dcterms:description: The Blender dataset contains eight objects (materials, drums, etc.) with complicated geometry and non-Lambertian effect. Each object is rendered for 100 training views and 200 testing views. We reserve ten training views for a validation split. The resolution is 800 × 800 pixels.
dcterms:title: Blender

dcterms:creator: P. P. Srinivasan
R. Tucker
J. T. Barron
R. Ramamoorthi
R. Ng
N. Snavely
dcterms:description: The LLFF dataset includes eight rendered scenes in total. All are captured by a cellphone with 20 − 62 images where 1/8 of the images are reserved for the test. We reserve another 1/8 of all images to form the validation split to tune model hyper-parameters. The resolution of the rendered frames is 1008 × 756.
dcterms:title: LLFF

dcterms:creator: J. Reizenstein
R. Shapovalov
P. Henzler
L. Sbordone
P. Labatut
D. Novotny
dcterms:description: The Common Objects in 3D (CO3D) dataset is a recent dataset containing 1.5 million multi-view images of around 19k objects. This dataset measures the ability of novel view synthesis in the wild. The 18,619 videos are divided into four splits: train-known, train-unseen, test-known, and test-unseen.
dcterms:title: CO3D
